result.execSummary:
All charges against Coty J Mayfield in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Coty J Mayfield is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed without prejudice.
*Reason: The State of Wisconsin asserted that it believes this matter lacks prosecutive merit. Also, the State asserted that it may have issues proving this case beyond a reasonable doubt at trial.

Order of Dismissal /s/ MDZ 09/28/22 
*Dismissed without prejudice.
*Reason: The State of Wisconsin asserted that it believes this matter lacks prosecutive merit.  Also, the State asserted that it may have issues proving this case beyond a reasonable doubt at trial.
Order of Dismissal filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 09/28/22 sp)
filed by the State (Sent to Br 1 Judge on 09/28/22 sp)
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Judge Michael D Zell assigned
Restitution Summary filed by the State
No contact with TRW

1:21 PM Defendant Coty J Mayfield in court.  Attorney Bradley W Novreske in court for Coty J Mayfield.  Attorney Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cassidy calls the case, states the appearances, and states the reason for today's hearing. 

Court questions Atty Novreske regarding Mr. Mayfield's previous non-appearance.
Atty Novreske makes statements. 
Court verifies address for Mr. Mayfield. 

Atty Cassidy is requesting the warrant be quashed and bond be set.

BY THE COURT: Warrant is quashed by the Court.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Atty Novreske has no objections to bond.

BY THE COURT: Bond set and preliminary hearing scheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
